bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Loma viuda de Rojas, September 2, 1940

div1.p: Hench sends Rojas documents to examine which are related to the investigation of the Camp Lazear site.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Loma viuda de Rojas, September 2, 1940
div1.p:
I am today sending you several
photographs, maps, and a memorandum on my investigations
regarding the San Jose farm, Camp Lazear, and the yellow
fever work. Not knowing whether you were still at the San
Jose farm, I felt it best to send it to your town house,
207 Calle 17, but inasmuch as I am anxious to have you see
it as soon as possible, I am hoping that your servants at
the town house will forward it to you if you are still in
Marianao. I will appreciate greatly your courtesy in going
over this material.

With kindest personal regards to
you and your family,
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
